document.masterDocTitle: A revision of the Neotropical spider genus Nops MacLeay (Araneae: Caponiidae) with the first phylogenetic hypothesis for the Nopinae genera

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A revision of the Neotropical spider genus Nops MacLeay (Araneae: Caponiidae) with the first phylogenetic hypothesis for the Nopinae genera

subSubSection.paragraph:
Type species :
Nops guanabacoae MacLeay, 1839
by monotypy.

Diagnosis . Members of
Nops
can be distinguished from non‒nopine genera by having tarsi subsegmented ( Figs 9A ; 32L); and from other nopine genera by having a small arolium with a pencil eraser shape on the legs I‒II ( Figs 5A ; 22A; 35I ‒J; 71K), absent from the legs III‒IV ( Figs 5B‒C ; 35K‒L; 54B‒C); an angulated ectal median margin of endites ( Figs 21B ; 29F; 38E; 60E) and a finger‒shaped labium ( Figs 21B ; 38E; 60E).
